final_answer.precision_note: The result is an integer value derived from integer bond enthalpies.

method: Identify bonds broken in reactants: 4 C-H bonds in CH4 and 2 O=O bonds in 2O2. Identify bonds formed in products: 2 C=O bonds in CO2 and 4 O-H bonds in 2H2O. Calculate total energy to break bonds: (4 * 413) + (2 * 498) = 1652 + 996 = 2648 kJ/mol. Calculate total energy released forming bonds: (2 * 805) + (4 * 463) = 1610 + 1852 = 3462 kJ/mol. Calculate enthalpy change: deltaH = 2648 - 3462 = -814 kJ/mol.
checks: Re-summing reactants: 1652 + 996 = 2648. Re-summing products: 1610 + 1852 = 3462. Difference: 2648 - 3462 = -814. Calculation verified.
